New Records: The Warriors set a franchise record for the largest margin of victory in a road opener with a 36-point triumph.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored 20 points in 27 minutes despite being listed as questionable with a right hip contusion.
Buddy Hield scored 27 points and made seven 3-pointers off the bench.
The Warriors won convincingly by 41 points, 127-86.
Six Warriors players scored in double digits.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors entered the game following a commanding 140-104 win over the Portland Trail Blazers.
The Jazz were seeking their first win after a narrow loss to the Memphis Grizzlies.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry expressed confidence in the Warriors' potential despite missing out on major offseason targets.
Coach Steve Kerr plans to utilize a 12-man rotation to capitalize on the Warriors' depth.
An insider anticipates the Warriors will make another significant trade during the 2024-25 season.
